67.title: Archie
67.author: [No author]
notes: "When Archie goes out to hunt rabbits, the safest thing to be is a rabbit!"

68.title: Archie

notes: Title from contents page.

69.appears_in: 2 p. text in Archie Comics, no. 13 (Mar./Apr. 1945).

72.title: Archie
72.author: [No author]
notes: Contents page title: "The Queen of the Maypole."

73.title: Archie
73.author: [No author]
notes: "There are a lot of ways of going broke if you're in business, but the surest way is to hire Arch as your salesman."

74.title: Archie
74.author: Bill Vigoda, Stan Borack
notes: "Who else but Archie Andrews could sit idly at home waiting for a 'phone call and wind up in a hospital?"

75.title: Archie
75.author: by Harry Kames
75.appears_in: 2 p. text in Archie Comics, no. 14 (May/June 1945).

76.title: Archie
76.author: [No author]
notes: "Fellows, all you have to do to be popular with the girls is to take them to a night club. Then challenge somebody to a duel, get beat up and lose your job. This is the system Archie uses in this story!"

77.title: Archie
77.author: [No author]
notes: "Archie goes into the baby-minding business and Pop goes nuts. It's a great life if you don't weaken!"

78.title: Archie
78.author: [No author]
notes: "Floogle's department store is enjoying a manpower shortage, 'enjoying' it because the boss has just fired Archie."

79.title: Archie
79.author: [No author]
notes: "Step up and meet the world's first casualty of an air-raid that didn't happen."
Title from contents page.

80.title: Archie
80.author: [No author]
notes: "Pop almost made a hole in one, in Archie's head."

81.title: Archie
81.author: [No author]
notes: "Every horse has two ends, even a masquerade horse. Jughead insisted on being the front end. So what does that make Archie?"

82.title: Archie
82.author: [No author]
notes: "Ever hear about the patient who was in wonderful shape when he died? Ask Pop Andrews. He knows all about it!"

83.title: Archie
83.author: [No author]
83.series: July/Aug. 1945) "You Can't Kill a Guy for Trying"

84.title: Archie
84.author: [No author]
notes: "When Archie makes the varsity team, thousands cheer, on the other side!"

85.title: Archie
85.author: by George Kapitan
85.appears_in: 2 p. text in Archie Comics, no. 16 (Sept./Oct. 1945).

86.title: Archie
86.author: [No author]
notes: "At last! Believe it or not, we've found something that can start off more monkey business than Archie!"
Contents page title: "Monkey Business."

87.title: Archie
87.author: [No author]
87.series: Sept./Oct. 1945) "Swing and Sway the Archie Way"
notes: "A one-man band at a high school prom is bad enough, but it's still worse when Archie's the man!"

88.title: Archie
88.author: [No author]
notes: "Archie had an air-tight alibi for not doing his homework. There was only one trouble. It didn't work!"

89.title: Archie
89.author: [No author]
notes: "Ah, memories! Happy memories of pleasant and peaceful days, before Archie was born!"

90.title: Archie
90.author: [No author]
notes: "Beauty's only skin deep, but who wants to look any deeper?"

91.title: Archie
91.author: by Ray Cohan
91.appears_in: 2 p. text in Archie Comics, no. 17 (Nov./Dec. 1945).

92.title: Archie
92.author: [No author]
92.series: Nov./Dec. 1945) "The Voice of the Wise Guy"
notes: "Every time Archie opened his mouth, Reggie Mantle put a foot in it!"

93.title: Archie
93.author: [No author]
notes: "Suppose you were the murder victim in your school play? You'd want a dummy to double for you, wouldn't you? So did Archie. He's no dummy!"

94.title: Archie
94.author: [No author]
notes: "Calling Dr. Andrews! The only one in the world who can cure rheumatism with a frog!"

95.title: Archie
95.author: [No author]
notes: "Archie found a lucky coin that really worked! Only trouble was, there are two kinds of luck, good and bad!"
Title from contents page.

96.title: Archie
96.author: [No author]
notes: "The only kind of race Archie wanted to be in, was the human race. But he wished he was even out of that, when they put him up for President of Riverdale H.S."

98.title: Archie
98.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Archie gets skis.

99.title: Archie
99.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Archie borrows a wagon for a hayride.

100.title: Archie
100.author: [No author]
notes: "Archie had a swell birthday present picked out for Mom, and he was determined to get it, even if it killed Pop!"

101.title: Archie
101.author: [No author]
notes: "A mighty man is Archie Andrews. He eats horseshoes and spits nails. Strong as a horse, and almost as smart!"

103.title: Archie
103.author: Bill Vigoda & (Pen?)
notes: "Archie's got a new invention that does away with washing dishes. It also does away with dishes."
Second artist's signature not deciphered.

105.title: Archie
105.author: Bill Vigoda, Al McLean
notes: "Everybody knows coffee keeps you awake nights. But Archie's the only guy in the world who lost sleep over a coffee grinder."

106.title: Archie
106.author: Bill Vigoda & (Pen?)
notes: "Danger! Pop at work! When Pop starts 'fixing' things around the house, well, we'll take the atom bomb!"
Second artist's signature not deciphered.

107.title: Archie
107.author: Bill Vigoda
notes: "Pop thought it'd be a good idea to get in a little spring football with Archie's team. He shoulda stood in bed. That's where he ended up anyway!"
Title from contents page.

109.title: Archie
109.author: Bill Vigoda & (Pen?)
notes: "Archie knew all about horses! He once worked on a merry-go-round."
Second artist's signature not deciphered.

110.title: Archie
110.author: Bill Vigoda
notes: Hunting and fishing story.

111.title: Archie
111.author: Bill Vigoda
notes: "Archie learned how to make a knot that's not a knot."
Archie gets a book of rope tricks.

112.title: Archie
112.author: Bill Vigoda
notes: About manners and chivalry.

113.title: Archie
113.author: [No author]
notes: "Archie and Jughead decided to paint the house. Outside of a few minor mishaps like the cat falling into the paint, the junkman taking all their furniture and the house nearly burning down, they had no trouble at all."

115.title: Archie
115.author: Bill Vigoda
notes: About waxing a floor.

notes: About nylon stockings.

126.title: Archie
126.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: Archie Andrews! I thought I sent you to do some shopping for me about an hour ago.

127.title: Archie
127.author: by Vigoda
notes: New year's eve story.

128.title: Archie
128.author: Bill Vigoda
notes: "Any gal that wants a guy to take her to the dance has got to catch him first and put her patch on him!"

129.title: Archie
129.author: [No author]
notes: Archie is Reggie's understudy for Hamlet.

131.title: Archie
131.author: Bill Vigoda
notes: Summary: Archie and his dad set up burglar traps around the house. They catch their rich uncle Titus, who turns out not to be rich after all.

132.title: Archie
